subclassFeature.name: Oath of Death
entries: The Oath of Death is a vow against the unnatural world. To protect the natural flow of life. There comes a time when a creature, regardless of its origin, must pass on and leave this world for the next. Paladins who undertake this oath attempt to ensure that those who extend their life long beyond what is proper can be brought to the Afterlife and join their kin in the beyond.

Paladins of this oath specialize in killing undead like vampires, liches, and ghosts, as well as those who make promises with fiends for eternal life. They may even take the lives of more peaceful beings, so long as their convinctions drive them to pursue an endless existence. A paladin who undertakes this oath may be called many things: a savior, the reaper, death, the law of worlds, or even a cruel assassin.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Death
entries: While the ideology of a reaper may differ from oathbound to oathbound (specifically in regards to what types of life should be protected, such as the Baelnorn), the general idea of the tenets remain the same.

entries.name: Pass the Torch
entries: Ease the soul's passing onto the Afterlife, and honor the memory any life born by the Creator.

entries.name: Protect the Creations
entries: Protect those who cannot fight, and guide those who cannot think. Guard those who nurse new life onto our world.

entries.name: Slay the Breathless
entries: Let those who have denied death and forestall its inevitable conclusion meet an honorable death so that they may move onto the next stage of existence.

entries.name: Bear Fruit
entries: Celebrate life with others, and aid the creation of the next generation.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Winter of the Afterlife
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to invoke the chilling presence of death. As an action, you cast the {@spell chill touch} spell using your paladin spellcasting modifier. This spell does aeon damage, instead of its normal necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Flame of Life
entries: As a bonus action, you can use your Channel Divinity to imbue creatures around you with the calm, soothing flames of life, and stoke it into majestic strength. Choose a number of creatures within 30 feet equal to your Charisma modifier. For one minute, attacks those creatures make deal an additional {@dice 1d4} radiant damage. In addition, those creatures also gain resistance to necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Preservation
entries: Starting at 7th level, you direct the air around you to protect allies from both the cold of death and the warmth of life to prevent them from dying before their time. You and allies within 10 feet take less damage from cold and fire damage equal to half your paladin level.
At 18th level, the radius of this aura increases to 30 feet, and you instead grant allies resistance to cold and fire damage.

subclassFeature.name: Beginning & End
entries: Beginning at 15th level, when an enemy creature deals radiant damage to a creature, you can use your reaction to cast a spell you have prepared that deals necrotic damage. In addition, when an enemy creature deals fire damage to a creature, you can use your reaction to cast a spell you have prepared that deals cold damage.

subclassFeature.name: Grim Reaper
entries: At 20th level, you can assume the form of arbiter of death. As your shadowy, translucent form manifests, you are able to guide creatures to the Afterlife with your raw phantasmal ability.
Using your action, you undergo a transformation. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are immune to cold and fire damage.
You can see 120 feet into the Ethreal Plane.
If an ally would fail their final death saving throw within 30 feet of you, they are instead stabilized.
You can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain.
When an enemy drops to below thirty hit points within 30 feet of you, they are outright killed.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
